channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report E-2024110193
item.description:
Report E-2024110193

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-08
  • City: WAITE PARK
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XBD experienced a UN3352 Lambda-Cyhalothrin 1 EC release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor. The box was damaged due to improper loading, appearing to have been hit by another pallet or forklift. A total of (8) 1-gallon poly jugs of product were found impacted and placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The impacted absorbents, cardboard, PPE, and cleanup debris were placed into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024110308
item.description:
Report X-2024110308

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-05
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Previously failed in HAP on 10/28 and 10/30. Caught on 11/4 and found that it had been repacked in a plain cardboard box. The original package was found inside with the exact same tracking ID on the label. Discovered 11/4 because tracking ID still had the code 97s on it which triggered error messages during the trailer loading process, and the DG Nav Specialist recognized the shipper name.
